snippet: The captains of each of the five police districts in the city will soon focus on community outreach, an area in which law enforcement officials and residents have had a long, troubled history.
abstract: Police force in Oakland, Calif, will be partitioned into five districts from its current two; smaller districts will each be led by a powerful captain who will be held accountable for crime reduction in regular meetings with police chief and for a focus on community policing; in late 2012, Oakland barely avoided becoming first American city to lose control of its police force to federal authorities.
lead_paragraph: The captains of each of the five police districts in the city will soon focus on community outreach, an area in which law enforcement officials and residents have had a long, troubled history.

headline.seo: To Cut Crime, Oakland to Reduce Size of Police Districts
headline.main: Overrun by Crime, Oakland Looks to Make Allies in Community
headline.print_headline: Overrun by Crime, Oakland Looks to Make Allies in Community
